Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, relaxing luxury”
Reviews.Author: gabbygrrl
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed an overnight stay at this hotel. I loved the location, as we could walk to Quincy Market and many shops and pubs in between. The room was beautiful. I especially loved the bathroom layout. It was spacious and had a TV speaker so I could listen to the Bruins game while I took a shower. The staff was welcoming although I must say, I saw them tripping over themselves for some of the other guests. It would have been nice to have 'that' type of service but we were more than happy. The concierge suggested a wonderful local brunch place that we loved! Overall friendly staff, nice bar for a beverage (but not the best bar layout), relaxing rooms that are quiet and comfortable, and of course, the Ritz experience. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and Luxurious Service”
Reviews.Author: Phil R
Reviews.Content: I recently celebrated the international women's day with my significant other, by splurging and treating ourselves to a night at the Boston Common Ritz Carlton. When I called to make the reservation, the clerk carefully explained to me the difference between all of the rooms and recommended one with an awesome view of the city. The concierge recommended an outstanding high-end restaurant and offered to get us a car or a limo. We had interactions with two different concierges, two managers, and many staff, and were treated like royalty the entire night. The room was a treat. It was clean, tastefully decorated, big, and had amazing Boston views. We ordered a cheese platter from the room service menu and were delighted with selection of blue, brie and gouda, which went great with a bottle of champagne. If you are in Boston and are looking for a luxurious and special way to spend a night, the Ritz is it!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO GET ENGAGED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elina S
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel to have the most romantic, fairy tale evening ever!! My (now) Fiance wanted to surprise me at the Ritz, but I later found out the staff accomodated his "secret scheme" by upgrading our room to the most breathtaking view of Boston. The concierge, managers and room cleaning were very courteous and all so positive and happy for me the morning after. Absolute best of boston, hands down (even if there is a ring on it!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Best city Ritz I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rogerslb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now during the past 2 months. As Platinum Premier was upgraded to the same end room with a great large window overlooking Boston Common. The front desk was always very helpful and I also like it when they say welcome back - in other words they had clear record of my recent other stay. Am surprised that ratings just average a 4 for the hotel. I found it to be the nicest city Ritz I have stayed at and one of the top overall non-resort hotels I have stayed at recently. My room was large, well-appointed and housekeeping services were very good. Bed was excellent and got very good night sleeps. Some reviews have complained about lack of traditional fancy Ritz dining options. I disagree and instead view this as a plus. There is very warm feeling bar and restaurant as part of the hotel. Bartenders are great, it's a social scene, and food is much better than most hotel places - encourage getting the daily special which on Monday's is a tasty Venison tenderloin dish. So overall strongly recommend staying here if you get and found that at times you can get a fairly comparable rate to less attractive lodging options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DWirt
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying here the night before my flights home. Convenient as it is close to Boylston Street and Boston Common. So easy to take a walk and tour the area. The more I stay there the more I enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: AnnGHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Ritz Carlton in Boston. My husband, son and I came to enjoy a long weekend in the city. Check in was smooth and quick. Within minutes we were relaxing in our room (we were upgrated to a suite!) Received A plus service at every turn: - Needed the sofa bed made up for my son ... two gentlemen were there in a flash to get it done and asked if there was anytrhing more they could help us with - Ordered room service for breakfast ... eggs, fruit, waffle were all delicious - Bell staff happy to get us a taxi and give directions - Late night room service hit the spot with soup, pizza and fries Our suite was beautiful and luxurious - the bathroom was so nice that I didn't want to go home! Kudos to the housekeeping staff as every inch of the suite was immaculately clean. We enjoyed our stay and look forward to coming back. Is this the best choice for everyone? Our room did not have much of a view, but we were out and about town most of the time in the day and did not miss having a view. The hotel does not have a gift shop, but there is a CVS drug store right around the corner (the same building) if you need any incidentals. These are the minuses we saw - not enough for us to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: moacca
Reviews.Content: Brought my son and 5 of his friend here for 8th birthday party, not only did they make last min special touches, cookies milk and child sized robes for each of the boys, but they also upgraded our room to a suite overlooking Boston Common, sent complimentary room service, balloons and popcorn/movie. Ashley D. Front dest agent and Michael B. Front house manager are phenomenal!! They really made it their priority to make our stay special. I cannot express how happy my son was to stay there. He never wanted to leave. My son loved the bath butler service, and they even sent him home with a Blue comfy Ritz carlton Robe and VIK pin! We will def. make this our hotel choice for all of our stays when in boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure”
Reviews.Author: mdlinda
Reviews.Content: 20$ for a glass Pouilly-Fuisse, a charge of 9.95 a day for Internet and a room on one side overlooking a gravel roof and Two double beds...not what you would expect from the Ritz..

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Ritz Carlton.”
Reviews.Author: Jenna181
Reviews.Content: I frequent Ritz Carlton hotels. This was a joke. The positives: pretty lobby, friendly frost "desk" staff. Room was clean, pretty new, and nice. Typical. But, here's the negatives: absolutely horrendous service. This hotel is fused with a local, but nice, gym. There is NO ritz: gift shop, spa, or quality restaurant. The two restaurants on location are modern and in no way, up to par with a Ritz Carlton with respect to atmosphere. You barely see any hotel attendants unless you are right in the lobby area, which is extremely, extremely boring. The bar area doesn't open until 5pm, and there is nowhere to get a snack unless you go to the attached, non-ritz operated and very crowded gym establishment. In sum, this place felt like an older marriot or typical hilton city hotel, which was stamped with the Ritz logo in certain places and given a few cosmetic upgrades. It absolutely pales in comparison to the Four Seasons which is just a few blocks away. When I walked towards the Four Seasons: there were 3-4 doormen, a greeter, a TRUE front desk and concierge, not just two small desks like the Ritz, and I saw staff everywhere. Granted, this is not a resort, it is a city hotel, but there is no warmth to it. No charm, and having no RITZ-owned spa services just kills this place. Basically, you cannot sit at the hotel all day and relax, there is absolutely no choice of options, unless you want to sit in a boring looking lobby with minimal service aside from the concierge and front attendants who were helpful. Just an average place to stay if you need a room, but by no means a Ritz Carlton experience. Stay away, and go to the Four Seasons down the block. There is no question about that.

Reviews.Title: “simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: jk5817
Reviews.Content: we spent the weekend at the ritz carlton in boston. It was a great experience from the moment we walked in the door. The staff was superb. Great location right next to the theater district,adjacent to the commons and in walking distance to all those shops on boylston street. LA fitness is adjacent to the hotel. They should make it complementary but minor issue. The restaurant had excellent service and food. But mostly it was the superb service that makes me recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average service, small room, wicked-pricey parking”
Reviews.Author: dannyrogue
Reviews.Content: Anytime booking a Ritz-Carlton hotel there is an expectation of 5-star service, comfort and amenities, and while the Ritz-Carlton Boston Common is definitely a nice hotel with elegant decor and a great location, there seems to be something missing in the service category, not to mention that the room was quite small. Actually, the service at the hotel was totally acceptable, everyone was polite and friendly, but it didn't seem like the staff really went out of their way to help me out with my luggage, or with any local recommendations. They also were not the most proactive at offering an alternative to their pricey parking, leaving me to circle the block to find a parking spot. Either way, the hotel is still nice, and if you're a Ritz-Carlton Club member, I'm sure it's tops in Boston, but otherwise I'd look for a hotel with bigger rooms that offer a better deal on parking (which is super difficult to find in Boston).

Reviews.Title: “A shame!”
Reviews.Author: clydodo
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Portland Oregon last week end after midnight. Nobody was there to take care of our luggage nor to open the very heavy doors. The doorman was arguing with another client! Same thing happened when we were leaving. The guy is arrogant, rude and there is nobody to tell him to do his job correctly. The food at the restaurant was heavy. On top of that the room had been prepared for a guy named Mohammed. There was a rug and a Coran to pray. Pretty weird. When we checked out, nobody asked us anything about our stay. They clearly don't care. Extremely disappointing. Far from a 4 or 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of Boston's best”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ritz in Boston numerous times on business. It is an exceptional property with service to match. Their recent renovations to the restaurant/bar and commons area is also a very nice addition. Service: check in and out could not be more seamless and there is always a friendly person at the front desk... not once have I been disappointed in the service. Room: fairly large rooms, typical Ritz decor, comfy beds with quite sleep. No complaints. Location: for business, I am usually taking a taxi from the hotel to my meetings... as a tourist, you could walk to many places from the hotel - albeit it is a bit of a walk. You are right of the Commons, which makes for a nice morning jog. Amenities: I like the new restaurant/bar... the BEST part is the health club which is expansive and on the property. Really nice facilities. Overall impression.... this is a great choice in Boston. Why not 5 stars? - - there isn't really a "wow" factor to get it over 4, but I would not hesitate to stay here again (and I will). Good choice for all.

Reviews.Title: “What you can expect when staying at a Ritz...great service, clean, quiet!”
Reviews.Author: mikeyz2281
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and have stayed at this Ritz in Boston quite a few times. The staff is polite and curteous and will also begin to remember their guests which is a nice personalized touch. The rooms are clean, well appointed and quiet. The door man is great! He can direct you anywhere and they also have a driver in the mornings you can try to catch a ride with...it's free and you get to roll in an S55 Mercedes...not a bad way to start your day. The restaurant connected to the hotel was delicious and the bartenders/servers were really nice. There is also a nice open bar in the lobby where you can grab a quick drink and unwind from a long day. There is a gym - Sports Club LA but be careful because it costs $15/day when you use it. The concierge should really mention this to their guests instead of just directing thence to the gym like its free. The location if the hotel is ok. It's near Emory College/theatre district so not many restaurants nearby. You can always take a nice stroll across beacon hill to find some good food though. Will definitely continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend holiday getaway.”
Reviews.Author: RIBluebird
Reviews.Content: We stayed over New Year's Eve. We booked the hotel through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts Program. We received all the amenities provided with this program except the room upgrade. They said that there was no room available, but when looking at room availability online the same day, we could have booked the upgraded room. Some people were being given champagne at check in. They seemed selective in who was getting the champagne. We stayed on the club level. The club room was overlooking the rooftop garden. The food presentations were nice. We didn't know until our 2nd or 3rd visit to the lounge that they had mixed drinks available. We only found out because we overheard someone order one. The club service was adequate and pleasant. They weren't overly attentive. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well. The rooms were quiet. We only had an issue one morning where someone was adjacent to us was slamming the door repeatedly whenever they went in and out (which seemed to be often). The view from the room was terrible. The view was also of the rooftop garden. The food and service in the bar and the restaurant was really not very good. We went down for a late breakfast New Year's Day and were told by the hotel that they were no longer serving breakfast (daily breakfast was included as one of our amenities). We left and went elsewhere to eat. When we returned later and went to the restaurant bar for a drink, we were given the breakfast menu because... they were still serving breakfast (and lunch too)! We were in the hotel bar (not the restaurant bar) for New Year's Eve. I was very surprised by the number of children hanging out in the bar and bar area. The level of service was not at all what I would expect from a 5 star hotel. When we left the room, there was frequently stuff (used room service trays, humidifier, etc) left out in the hallways that would sometimes be there for hours before being collected. The attention to detail just seemed to be lacking a bit for the level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service for the price”
Reviews.Author: zanev
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is nice and has a good location. Pricey, but so are most places in Boston. Room was nice, washroom was nice in our room. No complaints at all with the building itself. My issue was with the service at the hotel, especially given that it is supposed to be a 5-star AAA hotel. There were lots of people working all of time, especially in the check-in/concierge area. And there were always people who were not actively serving a customer. Yet when we arrived to check in, we had to wait for someone to come and help us. Then when we came to the concierge desk, there was no one there. We waited, obviously looking for help when one of the other staff finally came over and attempted to help us. What a joke that was, we were shown a map of Boston and taught that Cambridge was across the river. Wow, that helped. That night, I noticed there was some hair in the bathroom. I cleaned it up before my wife saw it and freaked out. The next day, we again got help from the concierge. This time, helpful with a dinner suggestion and making reservations. Except, it took more than 1/2 hr to get a call to our room saying the suggested restaurant was full. Not sure what took so long. But another suggestion was made and reserved for us. Which was great, except we never got a call back to say it was booked. We had to stop by the desk to hear that it was confirmed. Godd suggestion though - Stoddard's (I reviewed it very positively). Then I tried to call the spa to make appointments for us. 10 calls, no answer. Now I realize it is run separately from the hotel, but I really don't care. Reality is, I should get an answer. So we went to the spa to make our massagge appointments only to find out that the pool was closed. We were never told that and honestly, would never have booked there if we did know since we all wanted to swim. Note - there is a $15 per day charge to use the gym next door, they do advertise this on the hotel web site. Finally, we left our bags for the day as we checked out but had a late evening flight. Just getting our bags back was a nuisance as apparently only 1 person has the key and we had to wait for him while I watched 5 other staff chit chat and do nothing in the lobby. Very annoying. For a place that is supposed to be of a high calibre, I was very displeased. I would give a 0 or 1 rating, but the hotel itself is decent with a good location. But if you go, don't expect 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but..”
Reviews.Author: 54kerry
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed a long fall weekend at the Ritz-Carlton, Boston and overall very much enjoyed our stay. As previously noted in reviews, the hotel is more modern than many other Ritz-Carlton's, but we still found it welcoming. We had an executive suite, which had enough room for our family of 5 with a rollaway (3 children under the age of 9). The room was nicely decorated, and the king bed in the bedroom was very comfortable. I was not impressed with the quality of the sofa bed, but at least they gave us a featherbed topper to put on top of it. The bathrooms were outstanding, in particular the full bath in the bedroom, and I really liked having a "coat closet" in the front foyer. The location of the hotel is convenient to most attractions, but it's in a rather random few blocks on the edge of Chinatown and in the middle of a couple of schools, so there are a lot of students and bars. There are not a lot of restaurants in the immediate vicinity (2 block radius) , however that is not a huge consideration for most people. On the slight downside, the staff was helpful, but not overly so - I've had more helpful staff at other similar hotels, but that alone would not dissuade me from the Ritz-Carlton Boston. For me, the biggest downside (which was still rather minor) is that they really didn't make any accommodations for the kids. Frequently at similar hotels, there will be a small treat waiting for the kids in the room (coloring book or similar), or the housekeepers will do something sweet with their beds (a treat, or tucking in their doll, etc.) - but really they were pretty much overlooked during our stay. I did note in the book in our room that they offered amenities for the kids - bathrobes, etc. - but there were none in our room and it wasn't worth it for me to call housekeeping. Note, this was a minor detail on a very nice stay - it was not that the kids were unwelcome, and everyone was very kind to them. Overall, we had a great trip, and a lovely stay at the Ritz-Carlton Boston. Would we stay there again? Perhaps - but I'd probably look around for other options, in particular if the kids were with us. For me, it felt best suited to a business traveler, but comfortable nevertheless.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_Chris
Reviews.Content: Great location for work and play. Nice rooms and bathrooms. Very friendly and efficient service. Pricey but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel - Staff Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RobBflo1
Reviews.Content: I stayed two weekday nights at this hotel, and I cannot say enough about the treatment I received from the staff, the luxury feel of this hotel, and what a nice stay I had. First, the hotel, in my opinion, is in an excellent location, on top of the commons, within walking distance to plenty of attractions, restaurants, and business areas. It is true that there are some blocks a bit away that need some attention, but I never ever felt like there was any threat. Just a great spot. I also found the size of the hotel to be perfect, not too large, not too small, just right. Had a great bar area, roomy and well done. Did not eat at restaurant, but menu looked appealing. Another great feature is access to the LA Sports Club downstairs. it is a top flight facility, with a great gym, classes, spa, and other services. Lastly - the staff, everyone I encountered was pleasant, and really seemed interested in your having a great stay, just over the top service I recommend the Ritz Carlton Boston wholehearted!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel; Spacious Rooms; Very Responsive Management”
Reviews.Author: mozacq
Reviews.Content: Ritz-Carlton Boston Common is yet another shining example of why I love the Ritz. This is one of four 5-star hotels in Boston (I think...). As you enter the lobby, you have a great, modern fireplace bar in front of you and the bistro to your right. The entire hotel was maintained as you would expect at a Ritz, but there was something very nice about this particular location. It has an edge too it that I really enjoyed. Maybe because the design is a bit contemporary and the hotel is newer is comes off with a different feel. I was very impressed with our room. Although we reserved a basic room I was very impressed with the size; it was very roomy and of course finished as you expect from a Ritz. We dined at the bistro and later had friends for drinks. The food was excellent. We ordered some locally inspired appetizers (crab cake fritters and New England clam chowder) and I was very impressed with the quality of the dishes which both exceeded my expectations for the amount of seafood - just great. I was concerned regarding the speed of service during the evening but rest assured the entire management was on top of it. I was very impressed with their responsiveness. "As usual," the rest of the hotel staff was top notch. On a personal note, I just love this brand. I really hope they are able to resist industry's seemingly inevitable pressure to cut corners. I get it, but don't give in!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Ritz-Carlton and the staff get it...”
Reviews.Author: china4me
Reviews.Content: For me a Ritz-Carlton is about cleanliness and customer service. Stayed for three nights in one of their suites. It's not my favorite Ritz-Carlton but it lives up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: lobo19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz to celebrate our anniversary and it was fantastic. We had a view overlooking the Commons and the staff was excellent. The room was beautiful and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The location was perfect for walking all over the city. You do not need to rent a car since everything is in walking distance. A perfect weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JABOTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at this hotel and I was happy with my stay both times. The location is great. I've always had a suite with views of the Common and that has been nice. The better views are from the rooms with the higher numbers, I think the last room with the best views are "80" ( as in room 1080 or 1180) so try to get a room at least in the 70's so you will have a better view of the Commons if you stay in a suite. The only issue I have with the hotel is that they may nickel and dime you, as when they charge you for internet use. If you have a concern like that, when you check in they may take care of it and comp you for that expense. The service at the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: BCparent
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 4 times in the past 2 years at this Ritz Carlton property, and it never disappoints. The location is ideal for me: close to the commons and shopping/restaurants. From the (now familiar) doormen who remember me from previous stays to the reception desk, the experience starts on a high note. The small lobby is immaculate. If you're not in the mood to explore, having lunch or dinner in the lovely 1st floor restaurant is not a fall-back strategy because it's really good food and a quiet and elegant atmosphere. I have booked regular single rooms and a suite (wonderful) on one occasion. I have not stayed on the Club level, but I've got to think it's consistent with the high level of service etc... If you are a traveler who doesn't like to risk having a so-so hotel experience (I don't) and tend to stick to the Four Season's, RItz Carlton et al, I highly recommend this as an easy choice for Boston. On one Boston visit, I saved around $150 a night, and what a mistake, when I booked elsewhere. For me, it was not even close to worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Millymay022
Reviews.Content: Wow, this is my favorite Ritz Carlton I have been too!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton at Boston Common doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: MaxRoadster
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton, Boston Common is well situated to maximize a visit to one of the most historic localities in the United States. As one would expect from the name and address, this is a luxury hotel. My wife and I, upon presentation of our credentials, were quickly checked in and following introductions from Tamara at the front desk, accompanied by the friendly Bellman and our luggage to the room. After storing clothes and familiarizing ourselves with the room we partook of the Concierge lounge where Brian, Ryan and Jessica introduced us to the libations and delicious Hors d`oeuvre which were changed almost nightly during the stay. Later, we found the room was elegant and quiet for a relaxing first night as was predicted by Julia, Rooms Executive. Management and staff ensure delivery of every expectation one might have of finer accommodations; from the room, to the food and even beyond the confines of the hotel itself. This traveler made a day trip to New Hampshire but the return trip which could have ended poorly instead became an introduction to Bostonâ€™s latest reconfiguration of its street system. Travel maps and GPS systems prove inadequate when subjected to Bostonâ€™s one-way streets. Enter Ritzâ€™s Concierge, Adriatic. A cell phone call and it became very apparent Adriatic was totally familiar with the cityâ€™s one-way streets. In short order he had us at the front door and in a much happier state of mind. We found that Adriatic and his other half, Andrew were knowledgeable of all the best that Boston has to offer! This is the kind of client-vendor relationship that constantly reinforces this traveler to choose the Ritz-Carlton for hotel accommodations. Mr. Rajesh Khubchaandani, General Manager is to be commended for the courtesies extended by his staff from the doorman to those named in this review.

Reviews.Title: “tested the Ritz WOW factor...underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: haser59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz Boston over the weekend. First time to stay here as we have been at Boston Harbor and Four Seasons recently. Decided to try the Ritz as I had heard about the legendary "wow" stories. The hotel is nice and it is immaculate. Its not a stunning hotel by any means and is tucked away. Getting a cab is a 20-30 minute process so we typically walked up the street and found one as the valet folks are very busy. I saw the in room advertising Friday night promising unbelievable service ("let us find you a tailor at 5 am ex...). I decided to send out a pair of pants at 9pm Friday night to be laundered but asked that I get them back by 9 am as I had a meeting with someone in the hotel...Yes, they were only pants I had...poor planning on my part... I was absolutely and cheerfully told it was no problem. At 9 am I didn't have the pants. 9:15 someone knocks asking me if I needed laundry picked up...No, I am missing some pants ...9:30...I called and was basically told by the folks in the laundry area that I should get the pants to them earlier if needed them by 9 am. Then they couldn't find them. Then they said it was not their fault and on and on...it was really frustrating. Got the pants, still damp...late for my meeting. I felt horrible for being "that guy", though, and that I put them out so much. I honestly never try and test this service at hotels..But it was really underwhelming too.. I spoke to someone, didn't get his name, at check out and he apologized and said he would not charge me for the pants and "was there anything else he could do"? It just felt awkward and I felt very bad. I won't plan to stay there again...I guess I thought there would be more and I left unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Rstoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a business trip and it was absolutely lovely. The room I had was HUGE, with a foyer, large bedroom, and spacious bathroom. The hotel bar made for a nice meeting place after work and we often returned there after our dinner arrangements. Staff was extremely courteuous and helpful in arranging transportation. Location was within walking distance to many of the places that we needed to get to so that was also a huge help.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Bad Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: HRH2002
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Boston Common made a grave mistake in moving from its former, historic quarters in the city's best location to an average facility void of any personality or detail, located on skid row. While the hotel may have park views from above, once one exits its main doors and turns the corner, he is greeted by a grimy block full of shady individuals frequenting the adult bookstore located directly across the street. My travel companion and I felt incredibly unsafe in trying to navigate the surrounding neighborhood after dark, and were accosted by several beggars in the hotel's immediate vicinity. Furthermore, the rooms are lacking proper soundproofing and insulation, resulting in a very noisy situation. I would definitely recommend staying at one of the other luxury hotels located on Boston Common instead, as they are far superior in ambiance, service, location and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for the gym”
Reviews.Author: Rachelle H
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay, comfy beds, good sized room, but the real winner for me was the gym and the main reason for choosing the hotel. The lap pool was just what I was looking for and didn't disappoint. Add in a running tour of the freedom trail & the excellent glass of malbec in the bar was justly deserved!

Reviews.Title: “Children Only Permitted to Use the Pool on Sundays . . . Had to Cancel Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: My family LOVES the Ritz Carlton . . . the service, decor and atmosphere are second to none. My husband, two boys and myself have stayed at the Ritz in several locations across the country and were surprised to find the day before our trip to Boston that the Ritz Boston does not permit children to use the affiliated pool, with the exception of Sundays. The concierge at the Ritz invited us to walk down the block and use the pool at the Hyatt . . . sooo.... we cancelled our reservation at the Ritz and relocated to the Hyatt. We are hoping that if the pool is good enough for the Ritz to recommend our using it, then we'll be happy overall. In truth however, we are all pretty much down in the dumps about not staying at the Ritz. Has always been THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to Boston Common, impecable service, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Washingtonianwoman
Reviews.Content: I attended a Board meeting at this hotel and enjoyed the stay very much. The location is terrific right next to Boston Common and also close to the start of the Freedom Trail. The service was outstanding from start to finish. The bellman who helped me when I arrived greeted me by name every day when he saw me. My room was spacious and very comfortable. The hotel is built on top of a huge sports/fitness club which seemed fabulous but I did not use this since I prefered to run on he Common. I recommen paying the extra fee for access to the concierge lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Only the Sports Club LA Boston Lived Up to the Ritz Carlton Standards”
Reviews.Author: bbhayes21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the hotel for our wedding anniversary and stayed 4 days/3 nights. The location is excellent. It's steps away from the Boston Garden and walking distance to many restaurants and other attractions. The property is new and the rooms are well appointed. We had an interior room but we still had a view of a roof-top garden. The house-keeping did a great job with the up-keep of the room while we were there. The best part of the hotel and what truly sets it apart from the other hotels in Boston is the Sports Club LA Boston. My husband and I were truly impressed by the facilities. There are 2 floors of gym equipment and 1 floor of rooms for workout classes. The classes are excellent and very challenging. In addition to the gym facilities there is also a separate spa and salon. We really enjoyed using the Sports Club LA/Boston and wish there was a gym like that for us back home. The area that needs improvement is when you enter through the doors on the way to the elevator. The check-in was mediocre. We've gone to other Ritz Carlton properties that offer champagne during check-in In this situation, the bell man was thoughtful enough to offer us water as waited for the woman at the front desk to check us in and then get rushed through for the next guests waiting behind us. We were asked why we were visiting and we said it was for our anniversary, yet the hotel did nothing...not that I was expecting chocolate strawberries but not even a note when we arrived in the room..nothing. We had made reservations on Open Table for "Jer-Ne" the hotel restaurant but when we came downstaris to dine, we realized then that the restaurant was closed for renovation. When we asked the concierge, he told us we go to the lobby lounge instead. He was very aloof. He shrugged his shoulders and in so many words said, take it or leave it. So we left and went to the Bristol Lounge at the Four Seasons for an excellent dinner. When we checked-out we had called to have our bags picked up so we can store them, go to dinner, then come back to load them in the car and drive home. We waited 30 minutes and then my husband called again We waited another 10 minutes before we dragged everything down ourselves. We were noticeably upset and the valet seemed apologetic. When we checked-out the man at the front desk asked how our stay was and my husband explained what happened. He seemed awkward and gave a bit of an apology but then switched subjects. The doorman and the staff outside was great and hey greeted us by our last name. We found the lobby staff to be the weak link. They need a lesson what Ritz-Carlton service means. We're torn because we had a great experience at the Sports Club LA but after the mixed service we had at the hotel, we have second thoughts about staying there the next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, some poor service, rooms standard”
Reviews.Author: GengisAndLivingston
Reviews.Content: It was dissappointing for a Ritz Carlton. We stayed 4 nights, the room was large but pretty standard, nice bathroom, robes, no coffee machine, no free wifi, very noisy aircon, bed not great. For a quality brand this hotel was basic, BUT the service very efficient and prompt, the staff could smile more! Just off Boston Common and near subway stations, good location. The lack of free wifi in the bar/lobby was very disappointing. Wouldnt stay again as Im sure there are more value for money hotels in Boston even though we used points for our stay. No resturant as they are refurbishing it, breakfast in the bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AboyGT2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is part of a building complex consisting of a multiplex movie theater, fitness center and some retail stores. Once finding the entrance, as it is on a small side street surrounded by many one-way blocks, we were greeted with a warm and welcoming reception. The hotel is newly built and very polished as one would expect at a Ritz Carlton. Staff was very friendly and very accommodating with any of our requests. We were always addressed by our name and the housekeeping staff went above and beyond our expectations. Even having my children's favorite candy waiting in the room upon return from a day sightseeing. We stayed in a suite that was very comfortable, the bathroom was overly spacious and furnishings were high quality. Very quiet at night so no trouble sleeping. If possible try to stay on club level as you have access to lounge which provides daily continental breakfast (excellent fresh fruits), light snacks in afternoon and complimentary cocktails in evening. The fitness center and spa are not run by hotel but rather a large chain. So you basically leave the hotel from the elevator and gain access through the building complex. Fitness center was one of the largest I have been to with every machine imaginable including basketball and racquetball courts. Be warned though the pool inside is just a lap pool, not for kids to play. As far as dining , the restaurant was still under construction, so we only experienced the bar which seemed to get an after work crowd but still very cozy and pleasant. Overall we had an enjoyable three day stay, felt the accommodations were excellent and would recommend the Ritz as a good value for a luxury city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz "Moved" us by surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: njfamily5
Reviews.Content: Recently, on a short weekend trip that my family and friends squeezed in before dropping all our kids (ages ranging 6-16) off at camp we stayed at the Ritz Carlton. First let me say that for five years we lived in Boston and the Ritz-Carlton was located at the top of Newberry st. overlooking the beautiful Boston Commons- very swank. So, naturally, when we drove up from NJ we just drove straight there only to find that the marquee now read "the Taj" WHAT!! When we got back in the car and arrived to the new location, which is at the opposite end of The Boston Commons, we realized they moved to what was once known as the "Combat Zone" double WHAT!!! OK, nobody panic. We moved from Boston 13 years ago, and since then it is apparent that the city of Boston has invested in this area dramatically! They have completely revamped the area to a very safe and popular part of the city. And from the moment we stepped out of our car the service was exemplary. The lobby is trendy and inviting. The service and the rooms were exactly what you would expect from the Ritz. Furthermore, i came to realize that this relocation was probably a very well thought out business decision. It no longer emits a sense of eliteness. Rather, it caters to and embraces a more hip and sophisticated kind of crowd-without any stuffiness. Oh yes, i would be remiss if I didn't mention this incident: The parking garage called up to our room to report our tire was flat. They put a spare on it in 10 minutes! This discerning individual will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “amazing 700+ sq ft suite”
Reviews.Author: sasli
Reviews.Content: lets start by saying we had a wonderful time at the ritz for the july fourth weekend. location was awesome. right across from boston commons, walking distance to boston's chinatown, easy walk to lots of great locations!! we drove up to the hotel and took less than a few minutes for someone to take the car from us and get our luggage. however checking out, the guy was lazy and i can see he didnt want to help us load our luggage back in the car. yet expected to be tipped because he opened the door to the car for us. i can do that myself, thank you. the executive suite can fit probably 6-7 people although their policy only allows 4... there are two bathrooms. 1 shower in the main bathroom. tub and separate standing shower. absolutely beautiful. they claim to use bvlgari bath products but i didnt notice that they were? .. there are 2 tvs in the suite. also called housekeeping to request numerous towels/bath amenities/water and they came promptly. bottled water is free !!! thats a plus for someone who needs to stay hydrated like myself. we checked our car with valet. its pricey, yes but boston is a walkable city where most things are in the area. and also if you travel with a few friends the cabs can always be split amongst all of you. i had a corporate rate on this hotel otherwise it would be out of my range. definitely enjoyed my stay here. on our last night, we bumped into the toronto blue jays team just checking in for a game the next day (july5). we didnt go to the restaurant or use the hotel other than for resting and sleeping. if i come back to boston, i'd def want to stay here again with my corporate rate! best deal in town!! recommendations: sam adams brewery, boston duck tour, new england aquarium, swan boats in boston common, fenway park, prudential center at sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: BumbleBee28
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. Nothing too fancy but the view was nice and you could see the Boston Commons. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home: exceptional stay and service from everyone.”
Reviews.Author: CurieuseEmilie
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I got to the Ritz for a Princess weekend for me, as we were also going to see the Nutcracker at the Boston Opera House, a 30 seconds walk. This hotel was chosen for it's quality, attentive service and mostly because it was so central and offered valet service, a necessity for our first time in Boston. As we arrived from an 9h trip, we were taken care of by Brad at the front desk, who welcomed us in French (and we felt we were still home). Then we met the wonderful Sherly Michel, who was our contact for any question and spoiled us. On our second evening I ended up with a severe food poisoning from another restaurant (Durgin Park in Quincy Market), and I think it's really when we realized to what extend they wanted us to feel like home. The staff from the cuisine (Betty in particular) brought me thumbs in the middle of the night hoping they would help. All the concierges were aware of my condition, and were always available for any need whenever I called them. In the morning, when we realized we needed to be hospitalized, Sherly accompanied us; as we are Canadian citizens, we were unsure of what to do, and she stayed with us until we were taken care of, a good 3 hours later. She helped us fill paperwork, made sure we would have anything we could possibly need on top of what she already had to do that day. She also made sure my parents could find us in the hospital, had a good chat with them to explain what happened and how we were, and made sure that the minute we would be back in the hotel we would be taken care of by the staff. She hold my hand when I was scared and uncomfortable, reassured me and explained patiently anything I wouldn't understand. When you're really sick, away from home, in another country and in another language, having someone like her is such a blessing, and to stay in a hotel where you feel safe (and that your possessions are too while in the hospital) is such a relief. The staff knew who we were right when we came back, and attended our every need. And to our surprise, an exquisite bouquet with well wishes was waiting for us in our room. The next day we left to come back home early afternoon, and again, everybody was showering us with food, water bottles and make sure we were ok for the road. The careful, attentive, available, and generous staff, from the cuisine to concierges, doorman and coordinators and everyone in between will take care of you just like if you were family. Know that you'll be treated with the utmost respect, and be confident they'll do everything to make you feel comfortable and at home. We feel like we owed them so much, and the only thing they would say is that it was the least they could do. And despite our enormous hospital bill and the sickness, because of our experience at this hotel, we felt spoiled and had a wonderful time in Boston, and will certainly be back in a few months. Thank you so much again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven! True 5 diamond experience!”
Reviews.Author: ConcordNHLadyRider
Reviews.Content: The staff is the friendliest I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. The room was so luxurious. The healthclub on the premises is amazing. I loved the large tub and separate shower. Hotel is located near so many fun places. We walked everywhere and loved the bars nearby, including the one in the hotel. There is a huge movie theatre right next door, if you are bored or the weather is bad, but so many other fun things to do. Ask the concierge for ideas and you won't miss a thing. Downtown crossing is fun and there are folks there to guide you around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: NY414
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very pretty and the staff was great...when they helped you. Pulled up around 3pm not a single person in sight. I had to bring my bags to the front desk and then a valet appeared. Front desk staff was excellect, polite, professional, everything you would expect from a RC. Had dinner with my family in the restaruant. Service was very slow. Food was excellent though. You must try the cheeseburger. Sounds crazy, but trust me. Everytime my family and I interacted with the front door staff they were very cold and seemed bothered.

Reviews.Title: “overall comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: emu711
Reviews.Content: was here for two nights. we had a jr suite connecting with a double. the connecting doors were awkward to use. beds were very comfortable. we noticed there wasn't a coffee maker in the room. the sitting area was very nice, pleasant furnishings. some wear and tear here and there, but not too bad. the bath products were quite cheap. the body wash smelled just like the tamarind sauce i eat with indian samosas! really! the bath was very large, though. our toilet clogged the last day. would definately stay again if i could get a decent rate. $500/nt was too much.

Reviews.Title: “No HD TV - are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: VTing
Reviews.Content: I'm here for business, the Stanley Cup finals are on TV - but the picture in my room is terrible there is no HD, but the TVs are LCDs. I called house keeping, they sent up a technician to tell me they only have HD on a Few channels. This is the Ritz?????

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: dpegan
Reviews.Content: Perfectly placed by the common and the green lines, this hotel allowed me to walk to work and get around downtown boston easily. There was a problem with the AC in the room (squeaking), and they promptly sent up a mechanic who fixed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and pricey”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTripster
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly standard R-C hotel with and excellent staff. The property is somewhat unusual...small lobby with limited seating and only four floors not attached to the lobby. Rooms spacious and well equipped...furniture could use a refresh. Interesting that they charge an additonal $100 to use the club lounge...even for high level Marriott members. Restaurant is good but expensive...drinks are especially high priced.

Reviews.Title: “ZERO STARS- POSSIBLY THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE STAYED AT”
Reviews.Author: Lovz2Travel
Reviews.Content: If I could, I would give this property zero stars. This is due to the fact we could not even get passed the check in desk! As a member of American Express Platinum Services, we booked a decent rate that included their amenities. This hotel came strongly recommended. When we first checked into the hotel, there was one bellman who took a very long period of time to come up to our car. It should have taken less then a minute to figure out we were checking in. The bellman walked up to our driver and said to him through the window, "Aren't you going to help me." Our driver didn't respond and dind't help him as it wasn't his job to do so. The doorman then reluctantly got our luggage out and said a mark of disdain. Not very professional. Our saga gets even more interesting. We are standing in the lobby for 10 additional minutes in a crowd of people until finally an employee offered to check us in (it was about time). She looks us up on the computer and said she was unable to find our reservation. We gave her the Amex Confirmation with the correct dates and a reservation number and they still could not find the reservation. Many different people looked us up until they came up with some crazy story that they had us coming in a day earlier and we were a no show. Our Amex agent talked to the management of the hotel, who was apparently rude to the agent and after several hours the employees said very loudly they would be unable to accommodate us and we had to walk to another hotel with our luggage. Never in my years had a hotel claimed my confirmation was not valid or not even let us check in. Even if this was the case, instead of embarrassing the guests in the lobby, the hotel itself would be embarrassed and be extremely apologetic. You would think they would set up transportation to another hotel, set up the reservation, pay the difference in price, and while they were on the phone with Amex comp a lunch in the lounge (yes last time a hotel had a problem with our reservation, they did solve it, but offered us lunch while they resolved it). I CAN CLEARLY SAY THERE IS A COMPLETE DECLINE IN THE RITZ CARLTON STANDARDS. WE EVENTUALLY MOVED TO THE FOUR SEASONS FOR $20 EXTRA A NIGHT AND IT WAS SOOOO WORTH IT!!! WHATEVER YOU DO TAKE THE OFUR SEASONS OVER THE RITZ!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay at the Boston Common Ritz”
Reviews.Author: apitraveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this Ritz twice now and had exceptional experiences each time. From the attentive check-in all the way to grabing a cab after check-out we had a near-perfect trip. The staff were world class and extremely helpful - exactly what you would expect from the Ritz. Our room was amazing, and thanks to the AmEx deal this suite was an upgrade. A small downer was that we were very close to the elevators and could hear the motors churning every time they moved. Luckily this died down at night and we were tired. Room service was great (albeit expensive), we had a decent view (although we didn't come to Boston for the view), and the room was beautifully appointed. One of the highlights of staying here is access to the Sports Club/LA, a phenomenal gym with everything you could ever want! Normally I hate paying extra gym fees - especially after paying for a room at the Ritz - but at $15/day it's a steal, it's just that great. We look forward to returning to Boston and staying here every time we can. It has set the bar for me for what a fine hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: thewolffs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a small getaway from the day-to-day and found ourselves at the Ritz-Carlton as part of a weekend art auction. It was simply exquisite. We were fortunate enough to score a room overlooking Boston Common and the view was simply breathtaking. The Ritz-Carlton is in the heart of Boston and a stone's throw from the theatre district, Downtown Crossing, Chinatown, and Newbery Street. We caught the Saturday matinee at the Colonial Theatre where we saw Hair -- excellent performance! We also wandered through Chinatown and had our first "bubble tea" -- highly recommended! The hotel is extremely clean and the servic was impeccable. I do wish that they had a dining room, but the close proximity of some of Boston's best eateries more than made up for the minor inconvenience. If you are in need a late-night refreshment, there is a bar on the premises. Try the lobster pizza. It was quite lovely and probably prevented an uncomfortable morning headache. ;-) Many thanks to Jorge, our bartender for the weekend. His jovial presence was a delight! For the cheapskates like us who can't reconcile the need for the finer things.... - The Wi-Fi is not free. $10 a day or $25 for 3 days. - You can self-park or do valet, not free. - There is an on premises gym, $15, with an incredible pool - A burrito from Maria's Taqueria down the street - priceless (but a steal at $7)

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is the best”
Reviews.Author: Patrick B
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Boston and Ive been to many. I love the atomosphere, elegent and calm. This is a great spot

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: AnnGHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for a long weekend "get-away" and decided to try out the Ritz. The hotel did not seem to be very busy - and they were nice enough to upgrade us to a luxury suite. The suite was definitely well named as it was so luxurious that my husband and son did not want to leave the room! The room was huge, beautifully furnished and immaculate! The bathroom was beautiful and immaculate. (The weather was not co-operating with our plans - rain and snow and wind all weekend). Luckily there were plenty of places to eat and things to do within walking distance. When we did order room service, it was ready amazingly quickly and the food was very good. My husband enjoyed working out in the adjoining sports club as well. We look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumToronto
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at the Ritz Carlton in Boston Common last week. We'd never stayed there before and didn't know what to expect. Wow, what a fabulous 3 days we had!!! We were continuously greeted by name whether it was the front desk staff, restaurant waitstaff or the door men. The concierge, Evan, did a great job recommending a restaurant as well. The staff, ambiance and food at Jar Ne restaurant was all 5 star. The room was lovely and left us in need for nothing. We would definitely stay at this hotel and suggest that if you should read a negative review for this hotel, ignore it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SWIFTYS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, in an Executive Club Room. Our room was very spacious, although it did have a musty type smell, when we first arrived, especially the bathroom. However, this did fade, the bed was really comfy, it was a corner room, and it had a small seating area, but this had only 1 comfy armchair, the other was a desk type chair, which was odd! 2 plasma t.v's, a good standard bathroom, with separate shower. The club level, was very good value, it included Breakfast - continental, in the Club Lounge, there was Fruit, croissants, cereal, coffee, tea and juice, cold meats, etc. Tucker, the Butler in there was lovely. There was also included, light lunch, if you wanted it, soup, sandwiches, drinks etc, all day long there is drinks, coffee, tea etc. From 5pm there are pre-dinner nibbles, and from 8pm desserts! Not to mention wine, cocktails, phew! We tried the desserts one night, after they were raved about in previous reviews, but they were quite nice, but not fantastic! There was free Wi-fii also which was nice. I didnt really like the location that much, it was fine during the daytime, but found it a little 'rough' in the evenings. You could walk everywhere from the hotel though. there was a cinema just on the corner, and it was nice to feed the Squirrels on Boston Common during the daytime, they are very tame! The hotel was a very high standard and staff were excellent, very helpful and friendly. We had stay 2 nights and get one free, which made it really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bermuda2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, very convenient to various Boston activities. The beautiful 1 bedroom suite had dirty glasses etc from the previous guests. A few other mixups involving our reservation (made through AMEX platinum) but everything was very professionally resolved by the day manager. The concierge was very helpful getting us GREAT basketball tickets and making restaurant recommendations, car service etc. Nice location by park and T.Good main train line very close to Hotel. We would stay here again. Other than the dirty glasses and a few minor things very clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tyranter_new
Reviews.Content: We had the best stay here. The staff from the door to cleaning staff were superb. All friendly and would do anything to help. We had a fantastic one bedroom suite that was luxury. The club access is well worth getting with great food and drink. Also giving access to the fitness club on 4th floor that has to be seen/used to be believed. The staff in club level there are excellent providing so much help and advice that helped make are stay in Boston a very good one. We found the location great as well. Easy access to everywhere. ould recommend to anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel in an Club level room. The room was on the small side, but nicely decorated and with views over the roof garden. The bathroom was small but attractive, with a large bath and separate shower. The Club Lounge was excellent, with good food and superb service. The location of the hotel is also very convenient. However, it is not cheap - although internet access is included with the Club level service. We used the gym, which is open to the public, and is huge. However, it is not of the same standard as the hotel generally, being impersonal and with only water fountains available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....but is it worth the price?”
Reviews.Author: na07950
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a stay for a conference and thought the Ritz was very nice (but at the conference rate). The location is a little strange, but it was easy to walk to shops, restaurants, the North End, etc. My room was fine...very nice sized, comfortable bed (great pillows), huge bathroom with separate tub and shower and it was very quiet. The maid service was wonderful and everyone on that staff that I met was very pleasant. There is a business center (need room key to access) but it seems to be a secret (I only found out about it when I saw a fellow conference attendee enter it). They nicely ask at checkin what paper you'd like in the morning (but then I never did receive it), although they were very nice to let me check in significantly before the standard time. Would I stay here again at their regular rate - unlikely but I'm sure it's a great hotel for travelers willing to pay the high rates.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Ritz Carlton Boston”
Reviews.Author: kg30345
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of Ritz Carltons, and am rarely disappointed, and this trip was no exception. The staff was incredibly friendly and accomodating. I mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary, and the hotel manager sent some chocolate covered strawberries to our room. It was a nice gesture. The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. The bathroom is wonderful. It's one of the few hotels that I stay in that is completely soundproof - we never heard a door slam, a toilet flush, or traffic from the city. The location is fine. My husband and I love to walk, and we walked all over that city each day, and we found the location to work out very well. They offered to drive us to dinner in their hotel SUV, which saved us a cab trip. And, the concierge scored me some very difficult restaurant reservations for that night. Overall, we were so pleased with our trip and our experience at the Ritz Carlton, and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WheresMyEntourage
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights during a business conference. The suite was amazing, bed was very comfortable, staff very accomodating. Overall a great hotel. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Had Expected Quite A Bit More”
Reviews.Author: Travelingwithdog
Reviews.Content: It had been a very long time since I was in Boston. It seems the old Ritz Carlton building is now the Taj. The new building is close to Boston Common down a small side road, but not situated as nicely as its former location and not as prominently as the Four Seasons (which costs approximately the same). Had I known all this before my trip, I would have booked another hotel. In addition, although the building is modern and relatively new (built in 2001, I believe) it feels a bit cramped and unwelcoming in the lobby as the separate Spa & apartments take up a good portion of the available space. I also had the impression that hotel management was a bit lax and should have seen to it that the lobby and entrance were tidy and 'orderly'. (A table with a type of flower arrangement near the elevators went almost a day and a half with only stagnant water in the vases before the water was replaced and flowers put in.) I had several meals (a snack and 2 breakfasts) in the hotel restaurant and was fairly disappointed. Although the waitstaff was friendly and helpful, the meals were pricey and fully unspectacular. The atmosphere tried at urban chic and fell short. Another disappointment was that WiFi was an additional charge. For this class of hotel, one would expect it to be included. The room itself was not that large for a deluxe double room and the supposed views that were touted on the phone (all for an additional charge) turned out to be either a planted roof top garden or a few nearby buildings and a street view. (In addition, I had to change rooms upon check in as the first smelled strongly of cold cigarette smoke. The staff should have caught this before showing it to a guest!) All in all a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Another amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: gvvcz
Reviews.Content: Stayed on July 16th and 17th on the Club floor. Once again, I was treated like the entire staff was there solely to attend to my needs, and like nobody was more important. Or, at least that's how they made me feel. Morning breakfast was amazing. Lunch was even better. I'm not a fan of hors'deourves, but I had some Champagne. But the absolute tops were the desserts! Oh my God they were so amazing. Top notch in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: katiey424
Reviews.Content: We arrived before the July 4 holiday weekend and check-in was a breeze. The ladies and gentlemen of the Ritz-Carlton are always extremely friendly and helpful. The room was on the club level (floor 12) which is the top floor of the hotel. We did see several guests use the elevator for club access, so I assume you can purchase the club level room without staying on the club floor. Room keys are required for access. The location is wonderful - extremely close to Boston Common and the Public Gardens. Easy access to the T and close to several Boston tour trolley stops. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance, as well as Chinatown and the Theater district. The room was average in size with a separate bathtub and marble shower. I like the added touch of a mirror in the shower, as well as full length mirrors in the closet doors. We were traveling with a baby and the hotel provided a crib with bumper pads and a clean sheet as well as a small baby kit with shampoo, lotion, etc, and baby safety items (outlet covers, etc). The view was a city view but overlooked a modern rooftop garden display. We have previously stayed on other RC club level floors and the service here is excellent, however, I did notice a few things. The Boston club level closes at 10 p.m. sharp and is locked at that time. Other clubs we have visited were a bit more lenient, allowing guests to gather in this space without RC attendants, some even leave beverages out for guests to enjoy. Also, while the club level offers complimentary alcoholic beverages, the selection is limited. When a travel companion asked for a popular after-dinner drink, the attendant said the ingredients were not available and I ended up purchasing the drink downstairs in the restaurant bar and bringing it up. The food presentations were impressive with gorgeous desserts, a great breakfast selection, and filling mid-day snacks. You could easily eat all three main meals in the club. The concierge and club level attendants were extremely helpful in making dinner reservations. There is a house car with limited hours of operation so do inquire about it during your stay. The hotel also offers tea service with their special "cupcake tea" for guests of all ages. The hotel has a relationship with the sports club next door, so you can use their gym facilities and spa if you wish. Club level includes free high-speed internet and other services such as daily paper, garment pressing, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in an excellent location with 5 star treatment from staff.”
Reviews.Author: weybridgeresident
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 day trip to the Ritz, we were treated as if we were the only people staying in the hotel, all the staff from the managers to the bell boys were superb, always giving us a name and the staff in the club lounge were just amazing, nothing was too much trouble. We recommend this hotel very highly, we stay in '5 star ' hotels all over the world and very very rarely do they meet this ones exacting standards. The management should be very proud of their very fine establishment.! J and J Dunjay , Surrey UK

Reviews.Title: “Not living up to name”
Reviews.Author: Goahardi
Reviews.Content: All of the outward appearances remain at the Ritz level. However, the attention to detail is lacking. We've stayed at dozens of Ritz hotels, world-wide and this was my least favorite experience. We always book a room with concierge-lounge access, no exception here, however the concierge lounge is too small. Consequently, the staff fulfill "requests" for the things that you usually find on display at other Ritz'. The parking, understandably, is poor. Retrieving your valet-parked car requires at least 15 minutes prior notification. On a more sensitive note, I requested a band-aid, for my daughter, twice. No response, no apologies, nothing. Not what I've become used to. Both shower-heads in my room were not just broken, they were inoperable. Engineering's response was to rig one of the shower heads so that, with care, it could work. The fitness center is technically outside of the Ritz but can be accessed via elevator to a next-door, national, fitness chain. This could be viewed as positive or negative, but not Ritz-family-exclusive-friendly...nor very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Volenti
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel - with a laid back vibe, nice bar/restaurant, perfect location (steps from Boston Common), and all the touches and amenities expected of the Ritz. Expensive, yes, but it lives up to the billing.

Reviews.Title: “So close, but not quite”
Reviews.Author: boston65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton with our young children. The staff was always very friendly and professional, the room was excellent. The location is perfect - a very short walk to the commons. I also have to say the rate, for this class of hotel very good for a weekend stay. My hesitations... the service (whether it was the switchboard or waitstaff ) which was well intentioned but slow and the fan/air conditioning in the room was very loud (maybe it needed maintennance). Beware if you have kids looking for a swim - the pool is located at a next door fitness club (fantastic facility to be fair) - but children are only allowed to swim from 11-3 on Sundays.

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury Hotel In Boston!”
Reviews.Author: gvvcz
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a weekend getaway with my fiance and was treated like the most important person there. Upon arrival the front desk agent greeted us both by name. And congratulated us on our upcoming anniversary. We booked a deluxe guest room,but they upgraed us to a suite. When we got to our room there were chocolate covered strawberries and rosepetals on the bed. None of this was asked for. The booking agent knew exactly what to ask to properly customize our stay. The room was imacculate and huge! Great job will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN A GREAT CITY”
Reviews.Author: China2002
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton gets customer service right. We were upgraded to a suite which was very clean and spacious. The location was within walking distance to the park and the Opera House where we saw the Nutcracker performance and many other nice spots. I found the beds very comfortable and the room very clean with beautiful bathrooms. Brooke in the executive office went above and beyond to help make my daughters birthday special and helped with hard to find restaurant reservations for Thanksgivning. The restaurant downstairs was very nice for both breakfast and dinner. The staff was very nice to the children and the food was great. We all agreed when we were leaving that the Ritz in Boston was one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “No one does it better than the Ritz-an oasis away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Fosdyke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were attending a convention in Boston and had originally booked a room at the Mandarin Oriental (see MO review entitled, "Dirty and Disappointing"). As you may surmise from the title, the Mandarin Oriental was awful. Indeed, it was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had and for the first and only time in my life, I actually left a hotel. Angry, exhausted, and frustrated, the first alternative hotel I thought of was the Ritz Carlton. The Ritz has never disappointed me...and this time was no exception. I stepped into the lobby, took a deep breath of that fabulous "Ritz smell" and said, " I should never have strayed!" I was immediately invited to sit down and the front desk agent leaned toward me and said with genuine concern, "We were expecting you...AMEX just called to say you were on your way...what happened?" As I spilled the horror story that was my Mandarin Oriental experience, the concierge came up behind me with a glass of champagne with a perfect berry floating delicately and said, "I thought you may enjoy this." THIS IS HOW TO MAKE A GUEST FEEL LOVED! I literally felt like I had come home! The whole hotel is soothing...to the eye, the nose, and the soul! In short, no one does guest service like the Ritz....it is its specialty, its brand, and its pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice weekend...”
Reviews.Author: samlab25
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a family weekend in Boston. We typically stay at Ritz Carlton Hotels and had previously stayed at the old Ritz Carlton Hotel (now the Taj) in Boston. I was slightly put of by the reviews of the RC, so we looked at other hotels in Boston. Many were already booked for the long holiday weekend, so we decided to take a chance on our tried and true Ritz Carlton. We were not disappointed. We had a nice, club level room. Its typically what you'd expect for a city Ritz Carlton, rooms are adequately sized with nice, comforable appointments. The Club Level Lounge, as usual, was accessible and the staff was very helpful/knowledgable. The location was great, being right by Bostom Common. The only problem we enoucountered was trying to find the lobby concierge md afternoon on a Thursday. It wasn't a big deal since we could fall back on the Club Level concerige, but when we needed a map and wanted some informaton, it wasn't as handy as we wouldn have liked. I would definitely stay there again. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone looking for a weekend getaway or on business. It isn't a resort property, and it doesn't pretend to be. Its a great city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: bluesy58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz this past weekend in a suite. When making our reservations my husband requested a view of the Common (why stay on the Common if you cannot see it?) and we were told that they would put the request in but couldn't guarantee it. Upon arriving too early to check in we were subsequently rushed through registration (they only have two employees for check in and it appeared most of the time that only one was manning the desks). We were told that they would take care of our luggage until our room was available. Our bags were then placed on a cart and left unattended without the hotel identification tags. They were only attended to after we stood there and wouldn't leave until they were properly tagged. We left to walk around town and on our return were given our hotel key. The suite was not a view of the park and when my husband called down to again request a park view was told that we had a city view suite and that there wasn't another suite available. I find it hard to believe that there wasn't one available. Our "city view" was the side of the building next to us. The furniture was drab and appeared old. Having stayed at a Ritz before we were extremely disappointed. The only positive experience during our stay was the staff at the Club Lounge, they were very pleasant and helpful. When we went to check out in the morning again there was only one employee manning the desk during this busy time. I will not stay at this hotel again and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “made me feel like a VIP”
Reviews.Author: metalmaiden
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had! This was our first experience with club level. It was a bit expensive but considering just how expensive a hotel say is in Boston it was a bargin! (Club level was much less than the regular stay at other 4 and 5 star hotels in the area.) The staff was fantastic! The minute we arrived the valets hopped to attention and the doorman chatted with us about our triip. He seemd genuinely interested in whatwe had to say. Check-in was a breeze and very warm and welcoming. the lobby, the elevator, the hall ways to our room we elegant and beautiful. Our room was huge! We had booked this as a anniversary getaway and there was a complimentary offering in our room with a night acknowledging our celebration. The room was quiet, was beautifully appointed, had luxury toiletries, a very comfortable bed and the marble bathroom of my dreams! I'm a confirmed shower person but I couldn't resist the tub. It was a wonderful soak and with a TV speaker in the room I could follow the game along with my spouse while sipping champagne. The fitness facility is really a health club and it is one of the finest I have ever experienced! We went 3 times during our overnight stay we loved it so much! There was every possible type of equipment you could think of, all types of classes, a pool as well as a cafe, salon and spa. It was heaven! The club lounge was simply wonderful. There was food offered all day; breakfast, light lunch, cocktails and hors d'ouveres, dessert and coffe/tea. Complimentry beverages were available all day. There were no TVs so we spent a lot of time in there talking and reading and surfing the internet. It was beter than our own living room. The concierges in the lounge all wonderful; knowledgeable and always there to help or answer questions. We really were made to feel like VIPs. Everyone here was pleasant and professional. We felt welcome and a bit pampered. I told my husband I could get used to this type of service! I can't recommend this hotel enough. If you are going to Boston this is were you should stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star”
Reviews.Author: dcadog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in a king bedroom (1227) on the Club level. The hotel is centrally located with easy "T" access and a short walk from all of downtown Boston. Club access is a real plus even though it costs a bit more - good continental breakfast, light lunch, and drinks in the evening with good snacks and desserts, interesting books. Outstanding personal service in the Club lounge make it a 5+. We were able to check in early as requested on our reservation. Some little things matter. When we checked in, the TV didn't work, the bathroom had one bar of soap for the sink, bath and shower (all separated). Total of 2 bath towels. A flimsy, cheap contraption bridged the nice deep tub for the sole purpose of holding 3 washcloths. The device fell into pieces when it was removed, and we buried it under the sink. RIP. The bath items were quickly corrected. Turndown was missed one evening. The TV story is tedious and I was given several possible causes. Fixing it took about 2 hours in the early evening. Be aware that the hotel is on narrow Avery St, midway between Tremont and Washington. Most rooms have direct views of commercial or condo buildings or rooftops of same. Very, very few rooms have a view of the Commons. Arriving or departing by vehicle at rush hours requires extra time and extreme patience. Both Tremont and Washington are 1-way and are jammed at these hours. If you plan to arrive/depart at these hours, best take the T for airport travel. If not for the transportation hassle, I would rate the location as a 5. Biking around Boston is friendly and easy. There are good paths along the waterfront, Charles River, and more. Many streets, especially in Cambridge, have bike lanes. I rented a bike from the friendly staff at t http://www.urbanadventours.com/about.php, which is a short walk from the hotel in the North End. They will deliver to the hotel and have tour/rental packages. I walked and picked up my bike at their store and took off with a good map of the city, which they furnish along with helmet and lock. I greatly miss the original Ritz, which is now a Taj hotel. The "new" Ritz is nice, but no match for the original.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VBS_Boston
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect - close to everything. The hotel is top notch when it comes to service and amenities. The lady who checked us in (Amy) was just so sweet and wonderful and the concierge just gave us great recommendations for dining and area attractions. We will be back and highly recommend this hotel to anyone for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: maxpaste
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Club Level for a long weekend and had an enjoyable stay. We've stayed in about 8 other Ritz properties and would rank this one in the middle. The rooms are very nice and clean, and the staff is personable. Although the Club Level is more expensive, it's a really good deal if you plan to use the Ritz as your base for exploring the city. We ate breakfast there, had mid-day snacks, pre-dinner drinks, and desserts later. When you add-up the amount you would have spent on this, the room rates aren't so bad. Except for breakfast, you shouldn't plan on making any of their Club Level food servings your meal for the day. It's mostly high-end appetizers, snacks, and drinks, so you'll want to eat lunch/dinner out.
