The location is very convenient next to Boston Common, and the key attractions in the city are easily walkable. There is a subway station about 5 minutes away in the park. We felt very safe on the streets, and the town is a great mix of history and modern attractions. Summary: we are not Ritz snobs who complain when staff forget your name or when the stay isn't 100% perfect, so we enjoyed our stay. Although smaller in size and staff than many other Ritz's, it delivers what you normally expect - comfortable beds, clean rooms, friendly staff, and an attention to service.

Reviews.Title: “Just terrific”
Reviews.Author: Leatherman
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the club level. Let me tell you, I have stayed everywhere and I know a good hotel; this is one. The concierge who checked me in kept taking my pulse for the entire weekend. She knew my name and my sons names. The servers at the club level were amazing. BTW, in the building is a the LA gym, to which you have a free pass, and this is the best gym I have ever been in. The rooms are not huge but well laid out and the beds are terrific. There are some great hotels in Boston and this is one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: HLStride
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Boston Common from July 13, 2009 through July 15, 2009 and could not have been more impressed. The property had a very intimate feel and really had a "Boutique" quality to it. I had a reservation for one room on my first evening there with a promise of a connecting room the following night for two of my vhildren who were going to join me for my seconf night. The Ritz was the only major Boston hotel that would guarantee me a connecting room for the second night and they delivered. Upon my arrival at the hotel I was greeted by "Amy" one of the two check in officials on duty at the time. Amy was professional and thorough and got me checked in quickly. I found that the hotel had upgraded me to one of their "Club Level" one bedroom suites. The room was large (Two count them two bathrooms) a living room and a huge bedroom. The beds were amazingly comfortable and the entire suite was finished in elegant modern styles with traditional accents. Room service was prompt, delicious and reasonably priced. The room I had featured two large LG flat screen televisions and a Bang & Olufsen entertainment system. Cmplaints? Only one really, Like every other Ritz Carlton I have stayed in this one charged $9.95 per day for wireless internet. If I can go to Arby's and get free internet, I should be able to get no extra cost wireless at the Ritz Carlton. One other point, the Hotel employed a gentelman named "Stanley" as one of its doormen. Stanley was a great first contact for the hotel. He was thorough and efficient. A real asset to the Hotel. In short the new Ritz Carlton Boston Common is a gem. Tucked away on a quiet side street it is everything I could ask for in a modern urban Super Premium Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay each time I go!”
Reviews.Author: Phyllo6
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston about every 6 months, each time I stay at the Ritz-Carlton. The service is incredible! You are warmly welcomed by everyone. Anything you need is available for you. The entire hotel is very clean, with the exception of the vases in the hallway..people tend to throw garbage in them, and I suppose housekeeping doesnt notice. The last time I was there I had a corner room with floor to ceiling windows on both outside walls. With the curains opened we had an incredible view with planes flying from Logan airport, and the city. The restaurant Jer-Ne is fantastic! Again the service is great, and the food is to die for. On evenings the restaurant fills with a trendy crowd. In-room dining is also great! The food is hot and presented well. The staff also makes fantastic recommendations if you do not know where to eat, or if you are looking for a nice nightclub. My first time at the hotel the doorman recommended the restaurant Intermission in the theater district upon our arrival for a quick lunch, now it is a staple each time Im in the city. Whats nearby? Boston Common, T stations, Theater district, restaurants, coffee shops, bars, Beacon Hill. I absolutely would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to get mixed reviews. It may not be the best Ritz Carlton but it is certainly a very nice hotel. When we checked in it was a little busy, but the hotel staff handled the situation very well and efficiently. Our room was good sized and comfortable. It may not have had a major wow factor, but it was in very good shape and had a large window that overlooked the skyline even though the hotel is on the lower floors of a tall building. The bathroom was standard Ritz, with lots of marble, separate tub, shower, and water closet. The rest of the hotel is very attractive with nice earth tones used and contemporary artwork placed throughout the hotel. The overall feeling created is of a small boutique hotel with modern touches. Some however may find the atmosphere in the hotel restaurant Jer-Ne a little too club like for a Ritz Carlton. We had breakfast here each day. The food was okay, the service very good. A highlight of this hotel is the access to a sports club for a fee of fifteen dollars. Our package included admission. We feel strongly that spas and gyms should always be included in the price of the room, but this is one time when we would not have complained about the charge. This is one amazing gym. Very large and upscale, it is a place that could keep you busy for some time with lots of different activities. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful, even by Ritz Carlton standards. The immediate area around is nothing to write home about. But the location is central and Boston is a compact city making walking easy to most locations. Overall, this is a very nice hotel with great service that lives up to Ritz standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Marriott!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdiam1
Reviews.Content: When it was a birthday the place I wanted to be was Boston. Last January, I stayed in the new and wonderful Ritz Carlton White Plains. So, the first hotel I looked to stay anywhere was the Ritz Carlton. Upon arrival, I noticed the relatively small lobby, and one doorman manning the doors (the website did show 2). The bell-hop was friendly, but he did not give us a tour of the room, or how to use the very minor technology in the water closet ( they did this in the Ritz Carlton White Plains). I am not sure how old the pictures of the room on the website are, but not what we stayed in. All in all, it was outdated, and while the service was five-star, I just do not see a real hotel with a trace to Ceaser Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh...Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: siennatasi
Reviews.Content: I went with my mom over the summer for just a girls night getaway and I swear I don't think I've ever experienced anything so amazing. The staff was incredible, only caring what I needed. The room was just pure luxury (and I definitely had the best sleep in the fluffy bed!). For breakfast we went down to the restaurant at the hotel and it was just more of a relaxation. Everything tasted amazing and the service was quick. Later, we got 50 minute facials (which I highly recommend) but it felt like I spent a week in some warm exotic place it was just so relaxing. I was certainly relieved of any stress and had the best time ever. I just can't imagine staying anywhere else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “All Class”
Reviews.Author: jdross19
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Luxury. Incredible service. Beautiful, comfortable lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: TheGlobalFinn
Reviews.Content: - Our stay got off to a bad start, with us having to move to the Hyatt for one night due to a double-booking. However, the staff more than made up for this with an upgrade to a park view suite for the rest of our stay. - Very friendly staff, excellent service, comfortable rooms and excellent location for both business and pleasure in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: lovegoodhotels
Reviews.Content: This Ritz Carlton has spacious bathrooms and well equipped suites. It is in a good location across from the Boston Common area. However, the decor is drab and the food was bad and overpriced. The service was inconsistent. One day, they go out of their way to help you and the next, they don't have a clue. Upon check in, the man helping us was constantly on the phone connected to his ear and he was oblivious to us at times and didn't know anything about our American Express platinum amenities. The room they put us in at first had continual loud, booming noises that no one could identify. Also, the toilet was broken. They finally moved us to a room with no view but it was quieter. That is, if you don't count the sound of the air unit going off and on every 3 to 5 minutes. It was loud enough to drown out the sound of the t.v. and to keep us up at night. When we checked out, our bill was all wrong. They had over charged us for all kinds of things. Still, the room was kept clean and we did receive a call from Ana in Guest Relations about our problems. She apologized for our trouble and offered us breakfast on the house. Since we already received breakfast with our Am Ex package, we declined. This hotel falls short of the quality and service that any hotel should have, let alone a Ritz Carlton. I doubt we will return.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing: poor service in a cold new hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityAndy
Reviews.Content: Big disappointment. We fondly remembered the "old" Ritz in Boston. It's been replaced by brand spanking new hotel--an argument against "modernity". Just struck as a "cold" place overall. Some strong points of course (like the excellent hotel restaurant). But major service weakness you don't expect in large suite in a Ritz. Check in experience very bad (no real registration desk oddly). Broken phone in our room. Turn down service didn't arrive until 10 pm. Housekeeping made up the pullout bed by taking beddings off main bed---and then sent someone up with new comforter who had never seen a bed and couldn't assemble it. Wood panel dropped off drawers in bedroom. Pet peeve:only two diet sodas in mini bar. Finally because of traffic patterns it can be pain gettting there. Ritz organisation should take a look asap. Brand damage being done in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Bleh...room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: DocmomBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Boston Common for 2 nights because he had a meeting and the room was covered. Good thing someone else was paying because this place is NOT worth the price. The check-in was typical Ritz where they greet you by name after reading it off the luggage tags and radioing in your name to the staff inside the hotel. Check-in occurs at an intimate desk, making me feel like I was opening a bank account. A glass of champagne was offered at check-in--this was a nice touch. The room itself was very average and typical of one you would find in an Omni or a nice Marriott. The bathroom is typical Ritz with marble and a great separate shower and tub. The adjacent Sports Club LA gym is fantastic and is the best gym in Boston. The problem is that unless you're in a Club Level room, there is an extra fee to use the room. Are you kidding? With the price of a room, this should be complimentary! Overall, we had a pleasant stay but if I had been paying for the room, I would have been extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but have had better Ritz Carlton stays in other cities”
Reviews.Author: Qnstrvlr
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed the level of service during my stay at The Ritz-Carlton, Boston Commons. The room, a Club Level Executive Suite, was what I had expected from The Ritz-Carlton or any other luxury hotel. The only drawback to the actual room was its location next to the elevator and the lack of any view from the room. My wife and my disappointment was in reference to the level of service and the Club Level accommodations. My wife and I first stayed at a Ritz-Carlton during our stay in San Francisco, and also had Club Level accommodations there. The two experiences could not have been more different. The staff at The Ritz-Carlton in San Francisco were very courteous and attentive. Within the first hour of checking into the room, we were contacted to see if we needed any help with dinner reservations, tours or anything else in the area. The promptly got us into a restaurant, which we had wanted to try but were unable to secure reservations on our own. The guest manager also visited our room to provide us with a welcome present. We were pleasantly surprised at the selection and quality of the food offered throughout the day at the Club Level Lounge. This was one of the best hotel experiences we have had, and was a key reason why we choose to select the Ritz-Carlton when we traveled to Boston. Our stay at The Ritz-Carlton, Boston Common, had a rocky start. We arrived at about 5:45, although we had originally indicated that our estimated check-in time as 2:00. Even though we arrived almost four hours after the time we indicated, our room was still not available. Although we indicated that we had dinner reservations, the person checking us in was not very responsive and prompt in fixing the situation. After almost 15 minutes, he finally gave us a temporary room to change for our dinner reservations. Because of this delay, we almost did not make our reservations. Even though the person checking us in indicated he would call when the room was ready, he never did. The absence of an apology and poor attention to detail was very offsetting. Fortunately our room was available when we returned. In the morning, we were also disappointed at the food available in the Club Level Lounge. There was a very limited selection and the quality was not what we had expected based on our experience in San Francisco. Because we were so disappointed in the selection and quality, we did not return to the lounge. Later that night we ordered room service. The food was horrible and part of our order was wrong. My wife and I were also disappointed in the concierge service. Although we inquired about a restaurant for Sunday night, we did not get any information. We also were unable to locate the concierge when we were in the Club Level Lounge. Because of the lack of attention and the general inattentiveness of the staff, we were very disappointed in the level of service we received at The Ritz-Carlton. Based on this experience, The Ritz-Carlton Boston Commons will not be necessarily be my first choice when selecting a hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Unadorned”
Reviews.Author: Traveltoomuch79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Park view suite in May, the hotel was a standard Ritz Carlton. The room was very neutral in decor, the service was representative of a typical Ritz. Pros to the hotel include a great location, I went jogging in the Commons every morning plus they have a superb weight room. There's plenty to do in nearby Boylston and Newbury street. The Copley Plaza is only a short stroll away. The only Con, well the hotel offers nothing distinctive other than the gym, therefore I apologize to all for this uninspiring review.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Perfection!!”
Reviews.Author: jasonbourne1976
Reviews.Content: We just completed our stay at the Ritz Carlton Boston Common, and I must say, that I actually feel a sense of loss leaving such an amazing place. I've been in Boston since January for work, and have stayed at other luxury hotels, but the Ritz Carlton was the best experience I have had. My wife and I have stayed at the Ritz, Mandarin Oriental and Shangri-La in Kuala Lumpur; the Park Hyatt in Tokyo; and the Penn in Hong Kong, but the Ritz Carton Boston Common trumps them all. We stayed for 3 evenings in the club level room, and from check-in to departure, everything was perfect. The personnel at the club lounge were attentative, friendly, and caring. We had our 9 month old daughter with us, and everyone was very friendly and tried to give my wife as much help as possible. One of the ladies working in the club lounge, Barbara-Jean, was always very helpful and took extra care of my wife and baby. She even gave us a little toy for our daughter to play with, and always answered my wife's questions quickly. I wish I can remember everyone elses name, but I'm horrible with names! Also, we requested a late check-out since I was working, and it was iffy until the night before. The guest room supervisor, Lance (I think that's his name), was in the hallway and while chatting I mentioned I requested a late check-out because of my wife and baby. He said, "Consider it done" and we were able to leave around 5pm w/o any problems! Finally, the room service was excellent at the Ritz. I'm not a fan of room service, but the food was amazing! I was a huge fan of the Mandarin Oriental, and still am, but I have fallen in love with the Ritz Carlton now. Keep up the excellent work and don't change a thing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: NoPlaceLikeHome7
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in 6 months at the Ritz/Boston Common, and I don't know when I've been treated better! Hotel staff anticipate your needs, call you by name, and are incredibly gracious in an old fashioned, warm way. We stayed 5 nights both times, the most recent time was for my daughter's wedding. We wedding party and many guests stayed and the experience was amazing. The wedding planner was excellent. Food was first rate. The new ballroom is a great place for a meal for 100+ I would stay there again in a hearbeat. We will have beautiful memories of the wedding and of the wonderful venue. Soft goods (upholestry, drapes, bedding) have been recently upgraded and the service is "white glove."

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Oscillating_Fan
Reviews.Content: I had an exceptionally good experience at the Boston Ritz in April 2008. The reviews that criticize the views are valid, but that was the only thing I found at all wanting. The staff, starting with Jasna at the front desk, were uniformly excellent. The Club is spacious, had good food, and had a tremendous concierge staff. My room was big and very well done. I travel a lot. This Ritz was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: wickidkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Ritz-Carlton Boston Common over Easter Weekend in Mar 2008 while visiting family. Check-in: We arrived at the hotel late (around 9pm). We had reserved an executive suite room. Upon arrival, Sonya at the front desk upgraded us to a luxury suite. We were thrilled, but when we got up to the room, it was next to the elevator shaft, which was quite loud. So we called down to tell her we needed to downgrade back to the executive suite. Well, by that time, they must've given away our room (either that, or they never had it to begin with). We had to wait over an hour before another executive suite was ready. The new room had a Common view, but we were told the room was reserved for the next two nights, so we could only have it for one night. Room: The executive suite was so spacious. It had a hallway closet, half bath, spacious living room with a desk, french doors to the bedroom, a bedroom closet, large bath with double sinks, soaking tub, glass shower and toilet room. The bath products were Bulgari and there were complimentary products for the soaking tub. Service: The service at this Ritz-Carlton was just as stellar as you'd expect at any Ritz-Carlton. The door staff were friendly and would greet you each time you left and returned. We ordered room service each morning and it was always on time. On the last day, they did mess up one food item, but it was still delicious. Some of the nice touches included bottled water and towels for runners returning to the hotel after a jog in the Common each morning, complimentary hot chocolate each afternoon (so great after being in the blistering cold!) and a $1 million art collection throughout the hotel. You can ask the concierge for a brochure for the self-guided tour of the art. Location: This was the best part about this hotel. It is literally steps from Boston Common. It made it easy to walk the Freedom Trail and is close to many of the monuments Boston is famous for. We caught a matinee of Avenue Q at the Colonial and it was just a 10 minute walk. It's within walking distance of Quincy Market and just a little beyond that is the North End. It also has a train station nearby to get to other parts of the city. The only thing that I thought was weird was this hotel is connected to a movie theatre and is actually BEHIND it, so it does not directly face the Common. The hotel is on the 9th-12th floors of the building and only like two rooms on each floor face the Common - most rooms have a "city view" or a partial view of the Common. But there are lots of restaurants within walking distance, plus the shopping at Quincy Market. There's even a CVS just down the block. Food: We ordered room service each day for breakfast and the food was always great! They messed up our order one day, but we didn't mind because it was so tasty! They recommend reservations if you're having breakfast on Sunday morning, since Jer-Ne (the restaurant) is not that big. We had drinks in Jer-Ne one evening and the martinis on the menu were great. I highly recommend having something off the dessert menu. Check-out: It was quick and easy. The video checkout wasn't working, but they give you a statement on your door the last day and all you do is hand it to someone in the lobby if you have no disputes. Two days after we checked out, my credit card got some mysterious additional charges. After talking to them three times, I finally got them to understand that I had switched rooms after one night and that I didn't actually have two rooms the whole stay. They refunded my $800 once they figured it out, but without apology, which was unfortunate. I still loved the hotel and would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: kemahone
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a weekend trip to the Ritz-Carlton in Boston for my birthday, and we had a great time. We stayed in an executive suite and when he booked he had to buy the club option. We ate lunch twice in the club since it was included, and we were pleased with the food and view from the club. The suite was nice - no complaints. We entertained 5 friends on Friday night in the living room and it was comfortable. Room service food was good as well as drinks and appetizers (especially warm bread!) in the lobby/fire place sitting area. The staff was cordial and accomodating, and we experienced the luxury we expected at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravel81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton Boston Common Friday evening on a last minute business trip. Room was nice and clean, service was as expected at a five-star hotel. I don't usually write reviews, and have had good experiences previously at all the Ritz Locations (including SF, Boston, Singapore) but this stay honestly ruined my weekend. On Saturday morning, I left the room at 8:30am to get breakfast and find a charger for my phone. By 10:00am, when I had returned to my room, the hotel cleaning staff had emptied my room, thrown away my notes from a conference call I had scribbled on the bedside notepad, removed my clothes and dumped them in a lost and found bag. All this and I had not checked out yet! Now there was a conference in Boston that week and rooms were in short supply, but this treatment was ridiculous. They had basically emptied my room even though I had not checked out yet! I had to call clients on a saturday weekend (and spend some excruciating hrs waiting to reach another client who had taken an intercontinental flight) to go over their account details and follow up with my colleagues over the lost notes. Admittedly, some of it could be blamed on me for not backing up the data on my laptop, but I did not expect the hotel to throw away my personal effects with such alacrity . Maybe its not fair to give them a 1 point rating for an isolated incident, but I feel that a good hotel experience is one when you don't feel any inconvenience from staying in a different city. The rush job I received from the Boston Ritz Carlton utterly failed in this regard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hipcat36
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton's are awesome and this was no exception! The Rtiz in Boston is excellent. It's different though as it is much more contemporary then the norm Ritz traditonal fare... Some people may not like this about it but I quite enjoyed the contemporary feel. The bar and restaurant Jerne is also EXCELLENT. I stayed in a king club room and it was very nice and comfortable. The club room had excellent breakfast, afternoon tea, etc. The location is just off the Common so you can truly walk anywhere. Great location, great service, very nice comfortable room and dine at Jerne.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, still needs improvment”
Reviews.Author: atravellerboston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend here on a â€œBed and Breakfastâ€� package. It is a typical Ritz-Carlton. The room is nicely furnished, very decent size bathroom, Bulgari bathroom amenity, and the hotel location is good. In short, it is all you should expect from a luxury hotel of this caliber. The hotel staffs are very courteous. Everyone we met greets us graciously and wants to know if there is anything they can help us. Overall it is a good stay. Now here comes the rant: The package we have should include a â€œWelcome Amenityâ€�. We never got it. The package includes two American breakfasts. The regular â€œbed and breakfastâ€� package you can book on Ritz-Carltonâ€™s website only includes continental breakfast. I specifically mentioned that to the waiter at the restaurant, he brought us continental breakfast anyway. Since we actually didnâ€™t really care too much for the eggs, breakfast meat and potatoes anyway, we let it go. But nonetheless, not what you expected from a Ritz-Carlton. Donâ€™t get me wrong, overall the hotel is great. But it is small details that set the truly great hotel apart from just a good hotel. There is still more work needs to be done here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the old Ritz on Newbury many times, but this was our first stay at the new Ritz Carlton Boston Common. The feel is totally different, but just as luxurious; sleek and modern with an asian flair, and an amazing art collection. We stayed 6 nights in a suite on the 9th floor; it was about 900 sq. ft., with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the entire Boston Common. The suite was immaculate, and the furnishings seemed brand new. There was plenty of natural light, and there were two 42" plasma TVs. The club lounge was also immaculate and very well provisioned. The staff far exceeded our expectations, seing to our every need, and it seemed that the entire staff had immediately learned our names within minutes of arrival. We very much look forward to many return visits!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirlNyc
Reviews.Content: Had a very average experience at the Ritz. The location is great and within walking distance of most everything in Boston, which is really the only reason I could find to warrant staying here. The entire hotel is very dark. There are hardly any windows or natural light making it seem very dreary. The rooms were also disappointing; I found the rooms to be also lacking in natural light, (unless you end up in one of the very few rooms overlooking the park) making them gloomy. My room had a lovely view of the A/C units on the back roof. The furnishing is typical Ritz Style however the rooms lack in available electric outlet. The bathrooms admittedly are very nice, large and spacious with all of the amenities you would expect at the Ritz. The thing that really made me laugh is the amenity basket they choose to send me (I travel a lot and frequently receive welcome gifts from the hotels I stay with). I was sent a very lovely basket of assorted teas and little cookies, which was very nice however they neglect to send hot water, making the tea useless. All and all I was disappointed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Ritz in Boston”
Reviews.Author: rsp1
Reviews.Content: Had a very average experience at the Ritz. The staff, as with most of their properties, was excellent and accommodating. They were generally prompt with all requests. One notable exception was that, for some reason, delivery of a fax required a second follow-up call. The location is excellent and within walking distance of most everything in Boston. The rooms were most disappointing, especially for a relatively new facility. While the beds were comfortable and bathrooms nice, the furnishings were disappointing. The desk is somewhat small and the side/coffee table is about 12" across. The room had a 25" tube TV, which is inexcusable these days (not HD, not flatscreen, not 16x9) for this level of facility. The TV is in a cheap armoire that one would expect to find at the local Sheraton. It was difficult to find a free power outlet and the desk outlet was, for some odd reason, connected to the lightswitch by the door. This means that when the maid finishes cleaning and shuts off the light, your laptop is going to die about 90 minutes later if left plugged in. There is wireless internet, which works fine, and they provide free bottled water. The lobby restaurant is very good. One benefit of this hotel is the Sports Club LA gym. For a top hotel in Boston, I would definitely pick the Four Seasons or Taj over this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTotev
Reviews.Content: As you would read from the other reviews this is really a wonderful hotel, great location with excellent management. Few tips: - Upgrade to club level - it gives you access to the Lounge where you would find very very good food service throughout the day; it gives you free access to the Sports Club LA which is connected to the hotel and it is great; gives you free internet. - Use the valet parking - great service and very attentive. - The hotel restaurant is typical hotel restaurant - overpriced and blant. Boston has better places. We had a great experience in a wonderful corner room overlooking Boston Commons. Service was perfect, decoration great. By far the best hotel in Boston! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Ritz Property”
Reviews.Author: sunkissed518
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Boston Common for a four day getaway. We stayed on the 12th floor, club level- couldn't asked for anything better. We had a corner room, which overlooked the city skyline- amazing view! We were thoughtfully welcomed with a Godiva chocolate presentation on our first night. Furnishings were nice, as you would expect from a Ritz. The bed was so unbelievably comfortable, we loved the down comforter, high thread-count sheets, and plenty of down pillows. I hadn't slept so well in months! The bathroom was fabulous, wel-appointed with Bulgari toiletries, plenty of fresh towels and robes, and a much-used soaking tub. Very relaxing! Concierge and club concierge were amazing, so friendly and willing to help. Club lounge was comfortable and offered great little meals and drinks. Upgrading to the club level was certainly worth it, you definitely get what you pay for. Hotel restaurant, Jer-Ne, served great food, although service was a bit slow. I highly recommend this property, we had an absolutely wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent”
Reviews.Author: silkroad91
Reviews.Content: Truly excellent, staid here (for business again) also 10 yrs ago quality still top. Recomendable!

Reviews.Title: “Above average at best”
Reviews.Author: mindyt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently got back from a 3-night stay at the Ritz in Boston Common. We had a deluxe room overlooking a lovely garden. The room was quite nice, in a to-be-expected lovely Ritz Carlton way. We found the concierge to be ok at best, which was a disappointment as we have had wonderful concierges at other RC properties. In fact a couple of times we went over to the Taj, (which used to be a Ritz), and sought help from their concierge who was outstanding (we will probably try staying there next time). Additionally, I left a package at the front desk for a friend who was to be staying there 3 days after I checked out. I double confirmed with them they would give it to her. She never received it, which really made me angry. The highlight for me was the absolutely amazing Sports Club LA which is attached to the hotel. It is one of the nicest, well equipped gyms I have ever been in while at a hotel. If a gym is important to you, as it is to me, I recommend staying here for that alone. They also have a great breakfast/lunch place in the gym which is easy, fast and convenient. The location is wonderful, the rooms nicely kept and overall it was an above average experience, though there is room for improvement in the service area. And the hotel, although somewhat modern, is not as nice other Ritz's and other high end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK, convenient, but brutally expensive.”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as a guest and also helped organize a 60 person conference there. Service is good. However, numerous problems. Internet connection slowed to 30 kps for extended periods, which is effectively unusable. This is a common problem with Ritz Carltons. Expenses there verge on the obscene. A routine breakfast for two on Sunday morning was $65 with a single glass of orange juice coming in at $6. The fee for a projector for three days was close to $10,000, far more than the projector would cost. There are only two elevators, and when one broke down, extensive delays resulted. In short, OK (but not outstanding), especially if one is on an unlimited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Run-of-the-mill”
Reviews.Author: hanyu
Reviews.Content: Typical Ritz-Carlton decor. The room (a deluxe one I think) was quite suitable in size though the amenities are average, with an old TV, none of the usual little RC touches like collar stays and signature vanity sets etc. Service at the front desk was warm and effusive, in the signature RC way. Quite lovely though the staff asking us to call them to tell them if the room was okay was a nice gesture but not appropriate. As service staff, you should be the one doing the calling rather than get your guests to "report" to you. She even quizzed us on why we didn't call her when we came down to go out for dinner. The idea was a lovely personal one but the execution not quite appropriate. Location isn't the best. Grumpy buildings and graffiti surround one side of the neighbourhood. However, the intimate lobby is one of the best I've seen. All in all, okay but nothing special. Again, the 4 seasons shines out as the superior choice (though comparing with other U.S. cities, not by that much).

Reviews.Title: “Jer-ne - Not worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: LQSB
Reviews.Content: We live in a Boston suburb and stopped into Jer-ne for a pre-matinee luncheon. At first, service was fine but they seemed to forget about us as time went on. Water was never refilled and our meal was relatively slow coming out. After eating, we waited for quite awhile for a server but my 10 year old really need to visit the rest room. We left coats on our chairs and sunglasses on the table but we were practically chased into the lobby asking if we were leaving!!! Afterwards, we ordered tea and dessert. Mid-course we had to ask for napkins which had been cleared and never replaced. The food was fine but nothing special and I'lll not be dining here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont let the bed bugs bite”
Reviews.Author: Hiddenbay2005
Reviews.Content: I rencently stayed at this hotel and everything in the room was very nice along with the service. So with that being said I must tell that I was attacked by bed bugs and had over 40 bites all over my body. Moral of this story is that it does not matter how nice the hotel, take the sheets and mattress cover off and check things out. You will see the bugs or blood spots if they are there and you will be happy you checked. Having these bites is not pleasant. If you are staying in New York or Boston the high end hotels are experiencing beg bug problems so beware! Mabe it is because they have feather top mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: ANGshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I now stay at the Ritz whenever in Boston for either business or pleasure. While we have enjoyed both the Four Seasons and Langham in the past, the Ritz hotel and staff have made it impossible for us to stay anywhere else. While we certainly enjoy the contemporary and luxurious, but comfortable, feel of this hotel - it is Steadley at the front door, Kemal the front of the house manager, Gabe on the concierge floor and Tim with maintenance who have made this a home away from home. All have bent over backwards to develop a professional relationship with us - accommodating requests 'with pleasure'. While some of the room furnishings have become a bit worn, the rooms are very well kept and clean. The beds extremely comfortable, the sheets soft and extra pillows and blankets are provided in the closet. The Deluxe rooms are standard in size and the executive suites are apartment like with a separate living room and 1.5 bath. The large windows do open. The bathrooms luxurious with marble tiles/counter, separate shower and large deep tup. The towels are thick and soft. Note that we learned that the hotel will shortly be undergoing a soft renovation of all rooms and a full renovation of the lobby. This goes to show that the hotel is well aware of the need for new furnishings, the concierge desk is easily confused with the front desk, there is a lack of seating and the lobby offers a cold welcome. Although, as noted above, we have come to know the maintenance staff; that is not say that we are disappointed. Things go wrong, it's inevitable - it is how the 'wrong' is addressed. We have learned that Ritz staff are empowered to make decisions to resolve problems directly with the customer, ensuring that any problem can be addressed quickly and professionally. There appears to be little need for staff to haggle with management, those who work on the issue solve the problem directly (even financially). That's a great way of doing business. The concierge/club service is well worth the added expense if you plan to spend the day at / come back to the hotel. For example, we use the club room for doing business (wireless access included on floor 12), getting a cup of coffee and a bowl of oatmeal in the morning, lunch (it's an actual lunch in a bento box) and a glass of wine, cheese and desert after/before dinner - all without having to call, wait and sign for room service. It's the ease of having your own kitchen without the mess. Everything is ready, tasty and Gabe, the club concierge, is wonderful. With respect to room service, we would like to see an expanded room service menu. The menu is fairly limited and the restaurant (JerNe) does not appear to be all that interesting. The Ritz guests can take advantage of the LA Sports Club. The facilities are gorgeous and full service. The location is idea for us, walk to the financial district for work or walk through the Common to dinner. The hotel website accurately reflects the look and feel of the rooms and common areas. All in all, always a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: EastWest03
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter accompanied me on a business weekend in Boston. We had been told by a friend who had stayed in the hotel a few weeks previously that we should definitely give it a try. From the minute we drove up to check-out time, we were treated exceptionally well. Our 2 year old daughter was even catered to...they wheeled out a wagon full of toys when we checked in. She couldn't have been happier. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was stocked with everything you could need. I would recommend staying on the Club Level as the food service/afternoon tea/Cordials & Chocolate services throughout the day were an added treat...and very well done. The concierge service was first rate. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz was below expectations”
Reviews.Author: KMB4905
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Boston on business and stayed at The Ritz, Boston Common. I was very disappointed with the hotel from the moment that I walked in the entrance. There was only one person working at the check-in desk (I thought it was unusual that the front desk only accommodated one clerk). After checking in, I proceeded to the first hotel room that I was assigned and I immediately called the front desk to request another room. The bed sheets were torn, there were large, unsightly stains on the carpet and the lighting was terrible. The second room had similar issues - the furniture and carpet were old and visibly unclean, the room was not well-lit, and the towels had stains. I would absolutely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, As Always”
Reviews.Author: ocGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz-Carlton Boston Common several times. I am consistently impressed by the outstanding experience this hotel delivers. One thing to note: there are two Ritz-Carlton properties in Boston. The other property, the Original Ritz-Carlton Boston, which caters to a more traditional guest, will be changing hands in January. The property was sold and will be changing its name to "TAJ" The Ritz-Carlton Boston Common offers an intimate boutique like hotel experience, with all of the service and amenities Ritz-Carlton is known for. This is one of their more contemporary properties. Location: Located on the outer edge of the Boston Common Park, the hotel is within walking distance to the park, Beacon Hill, Newbury Street and other major attractions. This hotel is part of a multi-use hotel/residence configuration. Service: The service is absolutely outstanding on every level. The staff cannot help you enough. Everyone from the front desk staff, to the concierge, housekeeping etc. are there to please. Rooms: We were upgraded to an Executive Suite on this visit (pictures attached) Executive suites are approximately 800 sq. feet in size, with one and a half baths and King Size Beds. Standard rooms are also quite spacious, measuring almost 500 sq. Feet in size. All rooms include superb bedding with down duvets, featherbeds and wonderful linens. Bathroom amenities are also outstanding. Every bathroom in the hotel features a tub as well as a separate glass enclosed marble shower stall. If you have an opportunity, I would highly recommend staying on the club level. The club level offers five daily food presentations, which are absolutely amazing. During the week, they offer a "Bento Box Meal Option" for lunch which was excellent. They literally give you a lunch that would cost you $50 in the restaurant. You could almost eat all of your meals in the club, as they do a spectacular job with their offerings. Alcohol is also included with club. Facilities: The hotel offers its guestâ€™s access to the Sports Club LA, which I did not have a chance to use. I did hear however that it's a great gym facility. In conclusion, a wonderful hotel option while staying in Boston. It's closest competition would probably be the Four Seasons Boston as well as Fifteen Beacon. Try the Ritz-Carlton, and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A superb experience all around!”
Reviews.Author: twinkies
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 wonderful nights at the Ritz Carlton on Avery Street. EVERYTHING was outstanding. I've stayed at several Ritz Carltons before, and this one was really top notch. The decor is lovely - not overdone, but quietly elegant. The rooms were decently spacious for a city hotel & the bed was sooooo comfortable - wonderful down comforter, fluffy pillows. The service was impeccable - all of the doormen were super attentive, and often refused to even take tips, even after helping us to our car with packages or luggage. They were also very helpful in recommending restaurants, giving driving directions, etc. The restaurant/bar in the hotel is very hip. We didn't eat dinner there, but we heard it was very good. The bar fills up in the evening with a 35-45 after work crowd. The gym in the hotel in second to none, and there is also a nice cafe adjacent to the gym. I really can't say anything bad about this hotel! It was a wonderful experience! Oh - note that while the hotel is called "on the Common", it really isn't - it's down a side street off of the Common. Nonetheless, still great!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel that I have stayed in Boston”
Reviews.Author: horseneck
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few hotels in downtown Boston in the last few months. All were upscale hotels, the Coply Plaza... nice lobby, yucky small room, The Fairmont Copley Plaza, nicer, simply lobby, nice room, but everything is an arm and a leg after that. 40/nite to park, 50 for 2 pots of coffee... nothing else, just coffee. No coffee machines.... must have coffee in morning. The Ritz was nice, simple lobby, nice bar attached, reasonable upscale drink prices, nice big room, great marble bath, bigger than the other 2 hotels put together. The hallways were even elegant, most are not. We also had breakfast delivered in the morning, not cheap, 40 for 2 people, but it was a rare treat. Table with linen, flowers, arrived at our room as schedualed..... wonderful... Parking is still expensive...40/nite, but the overall atmosphere of the rooms and halls, and reasonable roomservice and snack prices were welcome. It is right down town near shopping and the common. Not much to look at from the outside, but there was a great dance club right around the corner, Felts... and was great to walk home to the Ritz. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ritz in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mkoury83
Reviews.Content: Went to the Ritz Boston Common for my Mom's 60th. Everything was taken care of (flowers & card) before we arrived. We had one club room, and one club luxury suite on the 12th floor, which adjoined in a private enclave in the hall. The rooms were very clean and well kept. Our view faced the financial district and was a respectable view considering the density of buildings in the area. Staying on the club level is key, breakfast alone is worth the extra money. All the staff in the club lounge were friendly and helpful, and the iced tea was literally the best I've ever had. Overall our four nights at the Ritz went perfectly. I have stayed at the Ritz on Arlington in Boston, and this one is better. It is clearly a business traveler's hotel, but was aptly conducive to leisure travel like ours. The location is unbeatable, with quick access to the T and all of downtown. Kristen, who seemed to work everywhere (downstairs & club lounge) was one of the friendliest and most helpful members of this Ritz staff, definitely an asset to the hotel. As a discriminating traveler, I do not hesitate to give this location a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Putin' on the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: BigEandKenna
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a crummy area. After a short cab ride from Logan, we were greated by friendly and helpfull staff.The Concierge was friendly and so skilled he was able to find me an Irish Pub within walking distance with the YANKEE GAME ON!!. Not a small feat in Red Sox world. We loved our room. The beds are great and the bathroom huge. We did have a problem with our room not being ready when we arrived (5pm). The only downside to this hotel is the neighborhood. Being a native New Yorker, cities don't scare me. But I was supprised at the amout of pan-hadling going on just steps from the front door. Boston could learn a lot from New York on how to clean up it's streets.

Reviews.Title: “Souless hotel in a decaying area”
Reviews.Author: NJD1_7
Reviews.Content: Not up to Ritz Carlton standards at all. We checked in to be told our room wasn't ready (it was 4pm) and to come back in an hour. No offer to take luggage or provide a drink. The hotel restaurant has closed due to lack of interest, and thus all your meals are taken in a rather bland bar that has a snack menu. The food is distinctly average, and the service stretched. The rooms are not 5 star standard at all, and this jaded part of Boston seems to rub off on the people here - it's gloomy and depressing....

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz is the place!”
Reviews.Author: mmansfie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton Boston Common, what a hotel. Its beautiful! I have stayed at Ritz's before, and this is just like the rest, top notch! I have read previous reviews about this hotel, and I cannot understand how someone would rate this hotel poorly. We were lucky and had a room overlooking the common. If you are a gym person, The Sports Club next door is amazing. The only thing is the location could be a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviewd”
Reviews.Author: Daoda
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel after reading the reviews here. I had a corporate rate and may not have been as happy if the room had cost $500/night, but I was very impressed with my experience. The room and bathroom were large, all the furnishings and amenities were stylish and top quality. The lobby is lovely and the staff was pleasant and helpful (this being Boston, no one is ever too solicitous). The only negative is the location--the hotel is down a street off of the Common towards the theater district, which remains a bit dirty. Still, you're 20 feet from the Common and close to everything. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here .. Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here to celebrate our 40th birthdays. We had planned this weekend getaway back in February, so we were all looking forward to it. There was 6 of us so we rented 2 ajoining rooms at the rate of $450/night/room. We stayed 2 nights so with taxes and parking charges we spent in total over $2000. All of us expected a certain level of service since we were staying at the Ritz, however this hotel certainly didn't meet what we would consider Ritz standards. The rooms were fine. They were clean with well appointed bathrooms, but nothing to get excited about. The service however was awful. The first night we were there, I made 20 calls to the bell man, before someone in hotel communications picked up the phone. Then on Saturday night before we left for dinner at 8:00, we requested to have extra hotels delivered to our room and our trash removed. When we returned at 11:30, neither request was fullfilled. I made another call to housekeeping and then finally things were taken care of. In my opinion, for the rates we were paying, we should have had nightly turn down service. I did speak with a manager when we checked out and he said he would make it worth our while to return, however all we received was a letter of apology. Needless to say, we have no plans to return to this hotel. My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Boston in February of 2005 and had a wonderful stay. The service there was impeccable as is service at all the Four Seaons that I have stayed at. If you are willing to pay Ritz Carlton prices, then I would recommend staying at the Four Seasons instead!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: raz24
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel with husband and children (15 and 7). Bellmen, vallet gentlemen very nice. Front desk people snobby, and always seemed as if they didn't want to answer your questions. Conceirge woman new what she was talking about, but not very friendly. Location was a few blocks from Newberry St. (through the park) Nice park, lots of homeless people. Room was on the 10th floor. Very nice room. Nothing over the top though. It was a decent sizewith very comfy beds and nice linens. Foyer of this room was very large, seems like wasted space. Bathroom very nice separate bath and glass shower. View was a roof, with a few small bushes planted there to offset the drab view. My biggest problem was the use or non use of the pool. The pool is not for children under 18? Maybe it was 16. All I know is, the person in our family who would want to use the pool most is 7 and she was unable to. They do have family swim hours, two hours on Sunday. You could also pay for swimming lessons, that also gets your child in the pool. Last but not least, parking is aprox. $37 a night. We used Amex Points not worth the 55,000 points a night and definately not worth the $495.00 rate they put on my room key folder.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are relatively nice and decor is beautiful but staff is poorly trained and charges appear without explanation. There is a hidden 10$ charge for using the health club (in a $500/night hotel??). In addition, we had three other unexplained charges after providing a credit card for incidentals. When I called I was placed on hold for 25 minutes taling to a supervisor. Is that the way to treat the kind of clientele the Ritz claims to target? I would advise staying away or don't give your credit card number. Big waste of time!

Reviews.Title: “Sad to see this hotel and area going down hill”
Reviews.Author: OutOfUSA
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel when we stayed there many times in year 2001. We went back in May, 2005 and found glory day was over for this hotel. Starter, there was no bellman in front-unthinkable 4 yrs ago. Front desk staff was pleasant but all negative, "no", "nothing". Very thin staffing. We booked suite-no view, looking over concrete roof, but the bed was worse. My side smelled so bad, if I were not that tired, I would have checked out. My husband side was ok. Furniture were old and cracked. It was obvious that upkeeping was not done well. There was no bath salt as used to be. They did not even replaced my shampoo. I had to call for extra soap for bath tub. One sign how bad hotel is doing is that their flagship Jer-ne restrurant is closed(!). It was an expensive but a beautiful restrurant. Now it is gone. Sports club LA-boston was still going strong and I see more young members. We enjoyed working out there. But the area itself-it was up and coming then-is now going down hill. Ritz boston common condos are still not sold, new movie theater is expect to close down. Sad to be back there -but we still remembered watching new year firework @boston common in our ritz suite-Best view in town. We will go for the old ritz next time though.
